data.title: Crossword from Two Words
data.solution:
import difflib

words = input().split()

w1 = list(words[0])  #Stores first word to list
w2 = list(words[1]) #Stores second word to list
tempW1 = [x+' ' for x in w1] #Adds space after each character in list
tempW2 = [x+' ' for x in w2] #Adds space after each character in list
used = False #Used to check for if word 2 is already printed

if len(w1) > len(w2): #Checks if words 1 length is longer than words 2 length
  w2 = tempW1 #Sets word 2 to word 1 with spaces
  w1 = tempW2 #Sets word 1 to word 2 with spaces
else:
  w1 = tempW1 #Keeps Word 1 the same but adds spaces
  w2 = tempW2 #Keeps word 2 the same but adds spaces

matcher = difflib.SequenceMatcher(a=''.join(w1).replace(' ', '').lower(), b=''.join(w2).replace(' ', '').lower()) #Lowerscases both words and removes spaces and check for matching characters
match = matcher.find_longest_match(0, len(matcher.a), 0, len(matcher.b)) #Finds the most occurring match

if match.size == 0: #Checks if there was no match
    print ("no common character".upper()) #Prints there was no match
else: #If there is a match
    for x in w1: #Every element in the list of Word 1
        if ''.join(x).lower() == ''.join(w2[match.b]).lower() and used == False: #Checks if the element in word 1 is equal to the match found in word 2 and if word 2 not already been printed
            print((''.join(w2).upper()).strip()) #Print word 2 uppercase
            used = True #Done with word 2 since we just used it
        else:
            if match.b == 0: #If the match of word 2 is found in the first index, no need to align columns
                print((''.join(x).upper()).strip()) #Print word 1 uppercase
            else: #If match is found in another index other than 0 in word 2
                print((" "*(match.b*2))+''.join(x).upper().strip()) #Prints x, aligns columns and uppercase

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You are given two words. Find the first matching character between the two words in respect to the first word, and then output the one with the largest length of the two horizontally and the smallest length vertically (if both words are of the same length then the second word given should be placed horizontally).

Both outputs have to separate each character with a space and be all uppercase, all while making a crossword from the two words.

If the two words given do not having a matching character, then output: NO COMMON CHARACTER
Input
Line 1: A string, words, separated by a space representing the words in order.
Output
The crossword from the two words or NO COMMON CHARACTER
Constraints
2 ≤ length of each word in words ≤ 8
Example
Input
cinnamon apple
Output
C I N N A M O N
        P
        P
        L
        E
